description: Demolition of existing buildings and construction of a mixed use development comprising 2,332 sq. m. GIA commercial space (use class B1(b), B1(c), and B8) over ground floor (with mezzanine of up to 1,703 sqm GIA) with off street servicing areas; 213 dwellings comprising 8 townhouses over ground, 1st and 2nd floors and 205 flats over 1st to 9th/12th floors with grade level access together with basement and grade level car parking, bin and cycle stores, plant rooms, alterations to highway, landscaping and associated works.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
Drawing numbers 17147_01_113 Revision P04; 17147_01_114 Revision P04; 17147_01_115 Revision P03; 17147_01_116 Revision P04 and 17147_01_119 Revision P01 all as prepared by Markides Associates.

Covering letter dated 25th October 2019 and emails dated 11th and 16th December 2019 as prepared by Paul Manning, Director, Newsteer Real Estates Advisers; Documents titled Planning Statement dated October 2018 as prepared by GL Hearn; Design and Access Statement, Reference 494_PT_DAS_FULL, Revision PL3 dated October 2019 and revised pages 98 and 99 reference 494_13_20191210_Street Parking as received on 11/12/2019 as prepared by Patel Taylor; Heritage, Townscape and Visual Assessment Revision 02 dated October 2018 as prepared by Richard Coleman Citydesigner; Daylight, Sunlight and Overshadowing Assessment Revision 02 document reference P1516 dated October 2018 as prepared by Point 2 Surveyors Limited; Transport Statement, document reference 17147_01_TS_D dated 10 October 2018 02 as prepared by Markides Associates Limited; Technical Note dated 9th December 2019 reference Project number 17060-01 as prepared by Markides Associates Limited; Draft Framework Residential Travel Plan, document reference number 17147_01_FTP_D dated October 2018 as prepared by Markides Associates Limited; Contamination Assessment/Land Remediation, document reference J17169 Issue 3 dated 15 October 2018 as prepared  by Geotechnical and Environmental Associates Limited; Desk based Archaeology Assessment document reference 24423 Final dated October 2018 as prepared by AOC Archaeology Group; Energy and Sustainability Statement/BREEAM, document reference 1018996_RPT_SY_001 Revision E dated 23 October 2018 as prepared by Cundall Johnston and Partners LLP; Economic and Industrial Land Strategy dated October 2018 as prepared by GL Hearn; Ventilation/Odour Assessment, document reference 1018996_RPT_BS_001 Revision C dated 23 October 2018 as prepared by Cundall Johnston and Partners LLP; Air Quality Assessment, document reference 22738_MHAEaling(A).9 Revision 2 dated October 2018 as prepared by Mayer Brown Limited; Flood Risk Assessment and Drainage Strategy Revision 2 dated October 2018 as prepared by Mayer Brown Limited; Noise and Vibration Assessment, document reference WIE14938_100_R_1.1.4 Issue 001 dated August 2018, Revision 02 dated October 2018 as prepared by Waterman Infrastructure and Environmental Limited; Framework Site Waste Management Plan, document reference number TWE_BWB_ZZ_XX_RP_YE_0001_FSWMP dated 15 October 2018 as prepared by BWB Consulting Limited and Commercial Agents Report Revision 2 dated October 2018 as prepared by CF Commercial.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

| Samples of all external materials for (a) external facades) and (b) landscaping including site enclosures shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the relevant part of the works on site (except for site clearance, demolition and construction of the basements).  The development shall be constructed in accordance with the approved materials and be retained as such, thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 1.1(h) and 2.1(c) of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013.

| The details of hard and soft landscaping including the tree protection and tree planting proposals as submitted to and hereby approved by the local planning authority shall be laid out and planted in accordance with a programme of planting works first agreed with the local planning authority and prior to the first occupation of any part of the development.  Any trees or plants which within 5 years of planting, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced with others of the same size and species and in the same positions within the next planting season.  The landscaping shall thereafter be permanently maintained.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2016, policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013 and policies 1.1(i) and 5.5 of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 Development Plan Document (2012).

| Based on environmental noise levels reported and mitigation measures recommended in the Noise and Vibration Assessment report Rev.02 by Waterman Infrastructure & Environment Ltd, ref. WIE14938-100-R-1.1.4 dated August 2018, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications (laboratory sound insulation including frames, seals and ventilators tested and approved in accordance with BS EN ISO 140-3: 1995 & BS EN ISO 10140-2:2010) and, where necessary, of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building), to achieve internal room- and (if provided) external amenity noise standards in accordance with the criteria of BS8233:2014.  Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise from transport/industrial/ commercial noise sources, in accordance with Policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, Policy 1.1 (e), and (j) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 Development Plan Document (2012) and Policies 7A and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013.

| The site is within the worse mode aircraft 1-day noise contour predicted for 2016 (60 dB).  Details shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval before the commencement of above ground works, for the insulation of the building envelope, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, which will achieve the internal criteria for sensitive rooms, as specified in Supplementary Planning Guidance 10.  The details should also include the provision of alternative means of ventilation in accordance with Authority's criteria. The works should be completed before occupation and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by aircraft noise, in accordance with Policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, Policy 1.1 (e), and (j) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 Development Plan Document (2012) and Policies 7A and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013.

| Prior to commencement of above ground works, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of an enhanced sound insulation value DnT,w [and L'nT,w] of at least 5dB above the Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/ uses in adjoining dwellings, e.g. living room and kitchen above/below/adjoining bedroom of separate dwelling. Details shall also demonstrate that the sound insulation value DnT,w [and L'nT,w ] of walls/floors/ceilings of communal areas and facilities is enhanced by at least 10dB above the Building Regulations value for residential use and, where necessary, additional mitigation measures are implemented to separate communal noise and to achieve the criteria of BS8233:2014 within the dwellings.  Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, Policy 1.1 (e), and (j) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 Development Plan Document (2012) and Policies 7A and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013.

| Prior to first use of each commercial unit, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of the external sound level emitted from plant/ machinery/ equipment and mitigation measures as appropriate, as measured at/ calculated to the nearest and/or most affected noise sensitive premises. The measures shall ensure that the external sound level LAeq emitted from plant, machinery/ equipment will be lower than the lowest existing background sound level LA90 by at least 5 dBA at the most noise sensitive receiver location at the development/ in the surrounding area.  The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity. Details of any noise mitigation measures shall be submitted for approval. A post installation sound assessment shall be carried out where required to confirm compliance with the noise criteria and additional steps to mitigate noise shall be taken, as necessary. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, Policy 1.1 (e), and (j) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 Development Plan Document (2012) and Policies 7A and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013.

| Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site and surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration, in accordance with Policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, Policy 1.1 (e), and (j) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 Development Plan Document (2012) and Policies 7A and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013.

| The use of the Commercial premises including related service yard areas shall not be permitted during the hours of 00.00 hours to 07.00 hours and 20.00 to 23.59 hours Mondays to Fridays; 00.00 to 07.00 hours and 16.00 hours to 23.59 hours on Saturdays and at no time on Sundays and Public/Bank Holidays.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from activities or people at or leaving the site, in accordance with Policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, Policy 1.1 (e), and (j) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 Development Plan Document (2012) and Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing adopted Development Management Development Plan Document 2013.

| Prior to commencement of first use of each commercial unit, a Servicing Management Plan shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing.  Details shall include commercial/industrial hours of use, times and frequency of commercial/industrial activities, deliveries and collections, vehicle movements, silent reversing methods, location of loading bays, quiet loading/unloading measures, etc. The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, fumes, smell etc. in accordance with Policy7.15 of the London Plan 2016, Policy 1.1 (e), and (j) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 Development Plan Document (2012) and Policies 7A and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013.

| Prior to use, shutters shall be installed with proprietary anti-vibration isolators to prevent structural or airborne vibration noise being transmitted and the closing mechanism shall be buffered to adequately silence the operation of the shutters.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration or noise, in accordance with Policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, Policy 1.1 (e), and (j) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 Development Plan Document (2012) and Policies 7A and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013.

| The sound insulation of the floor/ ceiling/ walls separating the commercial part(s) of the premises from dwellings shall be in accordance with the Noise and Vibration Assessment report Revision 02 by Waterman Infrastructure & Environment Ltd, ref. WIE14938-100-R-1.1.4 dated August 2018. Additional mitigation measures shall be implemented as necessary to contain commercial/industrial noise within the commercial/industrial premises and to achieve the criteria of BS8233:2014 within dwellings.  Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ adjacent dwellings/ noise sensitive premises is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, Policy 1.1 (e), and (j) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 Development Plan Document (2012) and Policies 7A and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013.

| Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, a separate demolition method statement and separate construction management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council.  Details shall include control measures for dust, noise, vibration, lighting, delivery locations, restriction of hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays and 0800 -1300 hrs on Saturdays, advance notification to neighbours and other interested parties of proposed works and public display of contact details including accessible phone contact to persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works and audit of existing condition of roads and footways to ensure that they be restored if damaged during construction.  The demolition of the site can only take place in accordance with the approved demolition method statement and can be implemented prior to the formal submission and approval of the Construction Management Plan.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, Policy 1.1 (e), and (j) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 Development Plan Document (2012) and Policies 7A and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013.

| All Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) to be used in the development site shall meet as a minimum the Stage IIIB emission criteria of Directive 97/68/EC and its subsequent amendments, unless it can be demonstrated that Stage IIIB equipment is not available.  An inventory of all NRMM shall be registered on the NRMM register at https://nrmm.london/user-nrmm/register. All NRMM shall be regularly serviced and service logs kept on site for inspection.  Records shall be kept on site detailing proof of emissions standards for all equipment.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, Policy 1.1 (e), and (j) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 Development Plan Document (2012) and Policies 7A and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013.

| Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority prior to occupation to demonstrate that the development complies with the 'air quality neutral' Building Emissions Benchmark at Appendix 5 of the Sustainable Design and Construction (2014) Supplementary Planning Guidance, London Plan 2016.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, Policy 1.1 (e), and (j) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 Development Plan Document (2012) and Policies 7A and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document, 2013.

| Based on the recommendations of the site investigation information already sent to the planning authority ( Ref. GEA Report J17169 version03 Oct  2018) in support of the application, prior to the commencement of any works on site (other than demolition and site clearance), a site investigation shall investigate the previously inaccessible ground as recommended in GEA report J17169 Oct 2018 to determine the condition of the soils, ground gas and groundwater with regards risk to future site users and the environment.  This assessment must be undertaken by a competent person, and shall assess any contamination on the site, whether or not it originates on the site.

a) A proposed site investigation plan shall be agreed with the local planning authority. The plan shall show the location of boreholes and trial pits with regards to the proposed layout of the site, proposed basement and other identified potential contamination sources such as the suspected landfill to the south east;

b) The agreed site investigation will be undertaken once the site is clear and access is possible. A report of the site investigation containing conceptual site model (CSM) and risk assessment shall be submitted to the local planning authority for approval.

Reason: To ensure that the land contamination issues are addressed in accordance with policy 1.1 (j) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 Development Plan Document (2012), Policy 5.21 of the London Plan 2016 and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan Policy 5.21 of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013.

| A detailed remediation scheme to bring the site to a condition suitable for the intended use shall be submitted to and subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.  The scheme must include all works to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives and remediation criteria.  The scheme must ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended use of the land after remediation.  The approved remediation scheme must be carried out in accordance with its terms prior to the commencement of development, other than that required to carry out remediation works.

Reason: To ensure that the land contamination issues are addressed in accordance with policy 1.1 (j) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 Development Plan Document (2012), Policy 5.21 of the London Plan 2016 and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan Policy 5.21 of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013.

| Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme, a verification report that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be produced and is subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority. The verification report submitted shall be in accordance with the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1'.

Reason: To ensure that the land contamination issues are addressed in accordance with policy 1.1 (j) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 Development Plan Document (2012), Policy 5.21 of the London Plan 2016 and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan Policy 5.21 of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013.

| The hereby approved 429 cycle parking spaces for the residential element of the scheme shall be designed, provided and maintained in accordance with the latest London Cycle Design Standards (LCDS), which includes 5% of the proposed spaces being wider spaces for adopted cycle/ cargo bikes, with cyclists also being able to access the storage area away from car/ servicing access areas.  These facilities shall be provided prior to first use of the approved development and be maintained thereafter strictly in association with the approved uses of the building.

Reason: To ensure that an inclusive and sustainable development is provided in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 Development Plan Document, 2012 and Policy EA of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013.

| Notwithstanding the information provided within the approved Transport Statement, Details of a Delivery & Servicing Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council prior to first occupation of any of the approved residential units and be maintained thereafter in accordance with the approved details.

Reason:  To secure an inclusive, safe and high quality built environment for all users of the site, and where appropriate constrain local highway impact. In accordance with Policies 5.12, 5.13, 5.14, 7.2 and 7.18 of the London Plan 2016; policies 1.1(e), 1.1(i), 1.2(d), 1.2(m), 5.4 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 DPD, 2012; and policies 5.12 and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD, 2013.

| No piling shall take place until a piling method statement (detailing the depth and type of piling to be undertaken and the methodology by which such piling will be carried out, including measures to prevent and minimise the potential for damage to subsurface sewerage infrastructure, and the programme for the works) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority in consultation with Thames Water.  Any piling must be undertaken in accordance with the terms of the approved piling method statement.
Reason: The proposed works will be near to underground sewerage utility infrastructure.  Piling has the potential to impact on local underground sewerage utility infrastructure.

| No residential properties shall be occupied until confirmation has been provided that either:- all water network upgrades required to accommodate the additional flows from the development have been completed; or - a housing and infrastructure phasing plan has been agreed with Thames Water to allow additional properties to be occupied.  Where a housing and infrastructure phasing plan is agreed no occupation shall take place other than in accordance with the agreed housing and infrastructure phasing plan.

Reason: The development may lead to no / low water pressure and network reinforcement works are anticipated to be necessary to ensure that sufficient capacity is made available to accommodate additional demand anticipated from the new development.

| Prior to first occupation of the residential element of the development, a Car Parking Management Plan for residents and visitors, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  These details shall include:

o	Details of how initial and future provision of disabled persons parking spaces will be made, managed and enforced to ensure that the approved disabled parking bays are retained for use by disabled residents only (whether M4(2) or M4(3) dwellings);
o	Details of how existing or future residents would request a disabled parking bay, how quickly it could be created and what, if any, provision of visitor parking for disabled residents is available;
o	Details of how the availability of parking spaces will be made clear to prospective residents prior to occupation to inform their housing decision and how residents would request a parking bay;
o	Other measures to manage parking demand on-site;

o	a programme of works for the provision of the car parking and the associated access and manoeuvring areas, these areas shall be laid out to the satisfaction of the local planning authority in accordance with that programme and shall not thereafter be obstructed or used for any other purpose; and
o	details of the allocation of parking spaces for each type of tenure of the residential units.

Disabled parking bays must not be allocated to specific dwellings.  Where a bay is being marked up for a specific resident, this should be done prior to occupation.  The communal parking spaces shall be leased rather than sold, and all available bays shall be open to any resident regardless of housing tenure.  The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the development and retained thereafter.

Reason: To control the provision, monitoring and maintenance of adequate facilities for all drivers including disabled drivers, in accordance with policies 6.13 and 7.2 of the London Plan 2016 and policy 1.1(h) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 Development Plan Document, 2012.

| Notwithstanding the parking bays expressly indicated as the electric vehicle charging points shown on the approved drawings, provision shall be made for the installation of ducting and cabling to ensure all the approved parking bays are capable of providing additional charging points to meet future need, in accordance with a programme of works to be agreed in writing with the local planning authority prior to any of the parking bays first being brought into use.

Reason: To promote the use of energy efficient and sustainable modes of transport in accordance with the Council's policies on sustainable transport in accordance with Policy 1.1 of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 Development Plan Document 2012, and Policies 6.1, 6.3 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2016 and the National Planning Policy Framework, 2019.

| The refuse and recycling storage enclosures hereby approved shall be laid out in accordance with a programme of provision agreed with the local planning authority prior to the first occupation of any part of the development and these areas shall not thereafter be obstructed or used for any other purpose.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety all in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 3.8 of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 Development Plan Document, 2012; policies 3.5, 7A, & 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document, 2013; policies 5.16, 6.3 & 7.15 of the London Plan, 2016 and the National Planning Policy Framework, 2019.

| (a)  Prior to final completion the permitted development shall implement and maintain, and in the case of energy generation equipment confirm as operational, the approved measures to achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 47.45% (equal to 138.50 tonnes of CO2 per year) beyond Building Regulations Part L, 2013.  These CO2 savings shall be achieved through the Lean, Clean, Green Energy Hiearchy as detailed in the approved Energy Statement as prepared by Cundall Limited dated October 2018 including:

(i)  Lean passive design measures to achieve an annual reduction of at least 11.19% equating to at least 26.40 tonnes in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over Building Regulations Part L 2013 for residential development, and at least 6.44%, equating to at least 3.6 tonnes, over Part L 2013 for the non-residential element.

(ii)  Green renewable energy equipment to achieve an annual reduction of at least 42.18%, equating to 111.90 tonnes in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the Be Lean/Clean stage of the Energy Hierarchy.  The renewable energy shall comprise Air Source Heat Pumps to deliver at least 94 tonnes CO2 reduction, and PV panels (approximately 34.5 kWp) to deliver at least 17 tonnes CO2 reductions.

(b) Prior to construction, completion details of the installed heat pumps and PV shall be submitted to the Council for approval.  The details shall include the exact Heat Pump thermal kilowatt output, heat output pipe diameter(s), monthly energy demand profile, and the exact number of PV arrays, the kWp capacity of each array, the orientation, pitch and mounting of the panels, and the make and model of the panels.  The name and contact details of the renewable energy installation contractor(s), and if different, the commissioning electrical contractor, should be submitted to the Council along with copies of the MCS certificates and all relevant commissioning documentation.  the development shall be implemented only in accoprdance with the approved details.

(c)  Within three months of the occupation of each phase of the development the relevant Energy Performance Certificates (EPC) and detailed SAP Worksheets showing clearly the TER and DER from the 'as built stage' following completion of the development, shall be submitted to, and approved by, the Local Authority for each residential unit in order to confirm compliance with the energy efficiency measures detailed in the approved Energy Strategy.  The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the approved details.

Reason:  In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure environmental sustainable development in accordance with Policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2016, Guidance note 11 of the GLA Energy Assessment Guidance 2018; Policies LV5.2 and 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013; and Policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026, Development Plan Document, 2012. | (a)  Upon final completion of the development and prior to occupation, suitable devices for monitoring any renewable/low-carbon energy equipment shall be installed.  The monitored data shall be automatically submitted to the Council at daily intervals for a period of four years from occupation and full operation of the energy equipment.  The installation of the monitoring devices and the submission and format of the data shall be carried out in accordance with the Council's approved specifications as indicated in the Automated Energy Monitoring Platform (AEMP) information document.  The developer must contact the Council's chosen AEMP supplier (Energence Ltd) on commencement of construction to facilitate the monitoring process.

(b)  Upon final completion and prior to occupation, the developer must submit to the Council proof of a contractual arrangement with a certified contractor that provides for the ongoing, commissioning, maintenance, and repair of the renewable/low-carbon energy equipment for a period of three years from the point that the building is occupied and the equipment fully oper
